div.p: Well I will write you again This morning as I have a few moments to myself I am fine and dandy and hope this will find you the same. I have the same trouble trying to keep out of the rain I know it rains here more than any place on earth I dont know how long it has been since it didn't rain a little every day. Oh this is a fine place for ducks I have moved since I wrote you last. I am at the front now or just behind the front. I can see the gun fire from here and the German aeroplane

fly over us. There was one came over yesterday and i watched them shoot at him but he was too high Oh this is a great life if a fellow doesnt weaken I have only been here a short time and dont know how ill like it yet. I am too far in now not to like any thing that comes.

Well how is everything back in the states wish I could be home for a few days But I am needed over here and I try and not thinkto much of home until the time has come when i can come home with the Huns Whiped. I dont know when that will be but I hope soon
The time goes pretty fast over here have been over a month but done seem very long but I have been working all the time and that helps to pass the time away.
Well Ellen i dont know very much to writ that I can tell so Ill close Write me ral soon and tell me all the news as I enjoy your letters very much with lots of love
P. S. Does Jim think he will come over any ways soon? Have they drafted any more of the boys frm Jackson
